10:05 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <Denis1> has quit  
10:09 <vmassol> good morning guys  
10:09 <vmassol> reminder: yesterday we were supposed to release 6.0M2  
10:09 <vmassol> mflorea: you're the RM right?  
10:10 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <mflorea> vmassol: good morning, theoretically yes, but Thomas did M1 and I was pretty busy with 5.4.x (still am)  
10:11 <vmassol> so we don't have a RM for 6.0M2?  
10:11 <vmassol> could you find someone if you cannot do it. What we shouldn't do is just not have anyone  
10:12 <vmassol> anyone willing to do M2?  
10:12 <vmassol> what's our status on M2?  
10:13 <vmassol> mflorea: you haven't sent any warning yet aobut the JS fwk for 6.0, are you still confident about the investigation for 6.0?  
10:13 <vmassol> I was hoping you could have started it after M1 but as you say you're still on 5.4.x  
10:13 <vmassol> so M2 is now and then it's RC and final  
10:14 <vmassol> there's 1 month left  
10:14 <vmassol> (max)  
10:14 <mflorea> yes, I was hopping too, but there were issues planned for 5.4.x and new EM/DW issues we found  
10:15 <vmassol> how come 5.4.x is taking so much time? I thought there was only 1 issue remaining for the past 2 weeks?  
10:15 <vmassol> did you find new issues after 5.4.3?  
10:15 <vmassol> (sorry I was away and didn't follow too closely for the last few days)  
10:15 <tmortagne> new issues have been found yes  
10:15 <tmortagne> spend some time on 5.4.x too  
10:17 <tmortagne> not blocker enough to make 5.4.3 unusable I think but still some important stuff to fix  
10:17 <mflorea> vmassol: there were 3 planned issues not one for the past 2 weeks, plus stabilizing the build, plus new issues, e.g. http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10186 (in the direction that EM/DW must work perfectly for 5.4.x)  
10:19 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <polx> has quit  
10:21 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
10:25 <vmassol> Denis2: hi  
10:25 <vmassol> Denis2: any ETA for the signed scripts? Can there be something in 6.0?  
10:25 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
10:26 <vmassol> (I know you committed stuff for it in 6.0 already but it's not yet usable as signed script AFAIK, right?)  
10:27 <Denis> vmassol: I do my best to have something working for 6.0 yes  
10:29 <Denis> and to have it right, which means we could evolve it without breaking or complex migrations  
10:32 <vmassol> ok great  
10:32 <vmassol> thanks  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> I'm looking on the build  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> a selenium test is failing and I probably know why  
10:54 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: does not seems to fail on jenkins  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> yes it does: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/lastBuild/testReport/  
10:55 <tmortagne> ha yes a new one  
10:55 <tmortagne> was not failing before  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> I was working on the panel wizard yesterday  
10:56 <tmortagne> ok  
10:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: I will continue releases on 6.0 branch  
10:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok great, thanks for proposing yourself! :)  
10:57 <tmortagne> (unless there is an issue I will take care of all 6.0 releases untill 6.0 final)  
11:00 <vmassol> kewl  
11:14 <tmortagne> now do we really want to release a 6.0M2 now ? it's been only one week since M1 and there is almost nothing in it  
11:21 <vmassol> good question  
11:21 <vmassol> 26 issues  
11:21 <vmassol> 20 by thomas ...  
11:22 <vmassol> mostly dep upgrades  
11:23 <vmassol> we could delay by a few days but it won't do much help  
11:23 <vmassol> so IMO yes we should release M2 and continue with the given dates  
11:23 <vmassol> and then possibly split RC1/final into M3 + RC1 + Final if we need to  
11:43 <cjd> vmassol: you might find this interesting: http://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/06/magazine/flash-boys-michael-lewis.html?\_r=0  
11:44 <cjd> I was facinated at how it works... turns out they listen on one exchange and then react on others so when you're trying to order on 5 exchanges, they're screwing you on 4  
11:44 <vmassol> long story, will need some time to read it :)  
11:45 <vmassol> thanks

13:16 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: is it normal that on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Flamingo+Skin/flamingo-profile.png the "edit" button is displayed? Same for add. Also, shouldn't we force the user to save or cancel before selecting another action?

13:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <vmassol> has quit  
13:50 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <spu7nic> Hi :) - is it possible to translate boolean property values in a livetable?  
13:55 <spu7nic> Or do I have to do this with Javascript?  
14:19 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:01 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: in my opinion, it is better to always have access to every features of the wiki  
15:02 <gdelhumeau> but it might be a problem for a "simple" user, indeed  
15:04 <vmassol> has quit  
15:09 <Emenems> has quit  
15:11 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <Emenems> has quit  
15:17 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <tmortagne> guys what do you think is the right way to put a new line in a XML attribute ?  
15:23 <tmortagne> JDK 7 stax writer is writing it as it is (does not encode it in any way) but then stax reader translate it as a white space. There is definitely a bug in one of them and I think it's in the writer from what I understood from the specs but If someone is sure of one or the other that would be nice  
15:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:35 <tmortagne> so summarize what I saw in the spec: \n is valid in the attribute but the W3C spec also recommend that XML parser normalize any \s\* into a single white space (HTML style basically)  
15:36 <tmortagne> which means that you loose any \n when the parser follow the recommendations
